title: What can I do in File Manager?
content:
There are Owned, Shared, and Public folders.
Owned: holds the files you uploaded or generated using ETC tools.
Shared: holds the files other users have shared with you.
Public: holds any files ETC users made public.

You can:
Upload files.
Create input files for Text Capture.
Contribute term categorization results to OTO.
Download selected files/folders.
Delete selected files/folders.

Each project should have one folder and do not mix files and folders in one folder.

title: Upload files
content:
If you have files that are suitable for ETC tools to process, you can upload them.

1. Add a new folder by selecting Owned and clicking on Add Folder button. Each project should have one folder, and do not mix files and folders in one folder.

2. Select the folder just created.

3. Select file type to be uploaded in the drop-down selection.

4. Click on Upload Files button.

You can zip multiple files and upload the zipped file. The zipped file should not contain any folders.

title: Create input files for Text Capture
content:
Text Capture requires input files be in a specific format.

1. Select a folder in Owned to hold the uploaded files. If Owned contains no folder, first select Owned then click Add Folder.

2. Click on Create Input for Text Capture and follow the instructions.

title: Contribute term categorization results to OTO
content:
The terms you categorized for the ETC tool can be used by wider communities if you contribute your categorizations to OTO.

1. Select a folder with TermsReviewed in its name.

2. Click on Contribute to OTO and follow the instructions.

If the button is not active, go to My Account under the site Menu to enable/set up the link to OTO.
